name: rooted
notes:
*[ ro͞ot-id ] | /ˈruː.tɪd/ 
adjective
1: established deeply and firmly.*

**rooted is the very first knititation pattern.  its simple, rhythmic design invites you to slow down, breathe, and root yourself in the present moment.**

*✨ knititations are guided knitting meditations — blending breath, intention, and stitches ✨*

[click here to experience the *grounding + breath* knititation on youtube.][1]

**gauge**
19 stitches and 32 rows = 4” / 10 cm in seed stitch

**yarn**
knit picks dishie (100% cotton; 100g / 190 yds)
*{samples shown in linen & hickory}*

**needles & tools**
6 us / 4.0 mm needles (or size to obtain gauge)
tapestry needle


  [1]: https://youtu.be/v5hfpielboe
